opposite_reasoning: While SubterraneanLayer provides the strongest conceptual opposition (above-ground vs below-ground), GeologicalFormation is more likely to exist in current ontologies and provides robust semantic distance. It contrasts atmospheric (gaseous, above-surface, fluid dynamics) with geological (solid/liquid, terrestrial, structural) properties. For Fisher-LDA, this creates a clear axis separating atmospheric phenomena from Earth's solid structures. GeologicalFormation has high availability and established usage in both WordNet and SUMO.
